goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions

Class GOALUserError

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.GOALException
          • goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.GOALUserError
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<GOALException>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GOALCommandCancelledException, GOALEnvironmentActionFailureException, GOALIncompleteGUIUsageException

    public class GOALUserError
extends GOALException
    An exception that serves as a notification of the fact that we could not handle something that the user did.

    This exception should never be thrown at runtime. The exception should only be used within goal.core.program for parser and validation related issues and within GUI/User interaction components.

    This is not a warning that can simply always be ignored; by throwing this exception it is made clear that something went seriously wrong.

    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
